metadata.title: CVE-2022-21824 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Due to the formatting logic of the "console.table()" function it was notsafe to allow user controlled input to be passed to the "properties"parameter while simultaneously passing a plain object with at least oneproperty as the first parameter, which could be "__proto__". The prototypepollution has very limited control, in that it only allows an empty stringto be assigned to numerical keys of the object prototype.Node.js >=12.22.9, >= 14.18.3, >= 16.13.2, and >= 17.3.1 use a null protoype for theobject these properties are being assigned to.

criterions.comment: nodejs: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
